dc_description_s: This layer is a georeferenced raster image of the historic paper map entitled: Icongrafica rappresentatione della inclita citta di Venetia : con tutti i canali Ry. Chiese Ponti. isolette, division de sestieri, i.e., vrbs Venetiarum ad exemplar typi majoris qui serenissimo senatui Veneto consecratus Venetys 1729 prodyt, in hanc minorem forman redacta curantibus Homannianis Heredibus. It was published by Homannianis Heredibus in [1752]. Scale [ca.1:2,260]. Map in Latin and Italian. The image inside the map neatline is georeferenced to the surface of the earth and fit to the European Datum 1950 UTM Zone 33N coordinate system. All map collar and inset information is also available as part of the raster image, including any inset maps, profiles, statistical tables, directories, text, illustrations, index maps, legends, or other information associated with the principal map. This map shows features such as roads, canals, drainage, selected buildings, city districts, and more. Relief is shown by hachures. Includes index, illustrations, and inset view. This layer is part of a selection of digitally scanned and georeferenced historic maps from The Harvard Map Collection as part of the Imaging the Urban Environment project. Maps selected for this project represent major urban areas and cities of the world, at various time periods. These maps typically portray both natural and manmade features at a large scale. The selection represents a range of regions, originators, ground condition dates, scales, and purposes.
dc_creator_sm: Harvard Map Collection, Harvard College Library
dc_publisher_s: Harvard Map Collection, Harvard College Library
